articles.description: The injury suffered by Nottingham Forest striker Taiwo Awoniyi has raised questions about the application of the offside law.
articles.title: Taiwo Awoniyi: Did 'late flag' offside law expose him to injury?

articles.description: Chelsea's Enzo Maresca is backed by the hierarchy at Stamford Bridge and is expected to stay in charge even if his team fail to reach the Champions League.
articles.title: Enzo Maresca: Chelsea to back coach even if team miss out on Champions League

articles.description: How does Liverpool target Jeremie Frimpong compare with outgoing Trent Alexander-Arnold? BBC Sport takes a look at the numbers.
articles.title: Jeremie Frimpong: How does Liverpool target compare with Trent Alexander-Arnold?

articles.description: British number one Jack Draper is knocked out of the Italian Open as Carlos Alcaraz shows his quality under pressure to reach the semi-finals.
articles.title: Italian Open 2025 results: Jack Draper loses to Carlos Alcaraz in Rome quarter-finals

articles.description: Formula 1's governing body reduces the penalties for drivers swearing or criticising officials, following widespread outcry.
articles.title: Formula 1: Driver swearing penalties reduced by FIA after outcry

articles.description: Rory McIlroy says he wants to "create more highlights" after completing the career Grand Slam - but admits the feeling of winning the Masters may never be beaten.
articles.title: US PGA 2025: Rory McIlroy wants to create 'more highlights'

articles.description: Listen to commentary of Aberdeen v Celtic or Open All Mics and follow live text updates of Wednesday's six Scottish Premiership fixtures.
articles.title: Scottish Premiership: All 12 teams play penultimate matches - LIVE radio, text, stats & head-to-head - BBC Sport

articles.description: American Coco Gauff defeats Russian teenager Mirra Andreeva in straight sets to march into the semi-finals of the Italian Open.
articles.title: Coco Gauff beats Mirra Andreeva to reach Italian Open semi-finals in Rome

articles.description: Australia's code-crossing star Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii is to have surgery to fix a fractured jaw before the British and Irish Lions tour.
articles.title: Joseph-Aukuso Suaalii broken jaw: Australia star in race to be fit for Lions

articles.description: Mads Pedersen claims his third victory in the opening five stages of the Giro d'Italia as Britain's Tom Pidcock finishes third in Matera.
articles.title: Mads Pedersen: Dane wins third Giro d'Italia stage with Tom Pidcok third
